Art. 4.99. 
Separation of assets 
The creditors of the succession may, in all cases and against any creditor, request the separation of the patrimony of the deceased from the patrimony of the heir.
This right can no longer be exercised, however, where there is novation by acceptance of the heir as debtor.
It is prescribed, in relation to movables, by three years.
With regard to immovables, the action may be brought as long as they exist in the hands of the heir.   ¤ 
The creditors of an heir are not entitled to apply for separation of patrimonies against the creditors of the succession.
